column4: when I boot off the live CD I get a message "ipw3945 Radio Frequency Kill Switch is on" and my wireless card is not available -- wtf is that?
check your BIOS?
but I haven't touched the bios -- it was working fine
with Ubuntu?
yes
then i suggest you look around in the BIOS and in Windows to see if anything changed.
I just switched it on today and got that message for some reason, so I tried the live CD and saw that message
I don't run windows, but ok thanks
you switched what on today?
the machine
manufacturer?
Dell
have you contacted them to find out what they do to the 3945 to possibly cause that message? because i have a Thinkpad with a 3945 and have never seen anything like that.
that message comes from ubuntu during the boot of the live CD
then the wireless card simply isn't there
right, and what causes Ubuntu to believe that that situation is the case?
no idea - nothing changed as far as I can tell
which is why i mentioned contacting Dell to see how their firmware interacts with that device.
ok thanks
I think I may have figured it out :)
suave
I have pressed one of those Fn+<something> buttons
Don't Do That(tm)
yep, my wireless is back - thanks for the tips
